title: The Lodger: A Story of the London Fog

sources.title: The Lodger: A Story of the London Fog (1927)
sources.description: "The Lodger" is a silent horror-thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock, based on the novel by Marie Belloc Lowndes. Set in London, the story revolves around a mysterious lodger who rents a room from a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bunting, in their home. Set against the backdrop of London during the infamous Jack the Ripper murders, the story follows a couple, Mr. and Mrs. Bunting , who take in a mysterious lodger into their home. As the Buntings become increasingly suspicious of their tenantâ€™s peculiar habits and secretive behavior, they grapple with the fear that he might be connected to the gruesome crimes plaguing the city.

metadata.Plot: A serial killer known as "The Avenger" is on the loose in London, murdering blonde women. A mysterious man arrives at the house of Mr. and Mrs. Bunting looking for a room to rent. The Bunting's daughter is a blonde model and is seeing one of the detectives assigned to the case. The detective becomes jealous of the lodger and begins to suspect he may be the avenger.
metadata.Writer: Marie Belloc Lowndes, Eliot Stannard, Alfred Hitchcock
metadata.Actors: June Tripp, Ivor Novello, Marie Ault
